column4: Where are the tool bars on the ubuntu desktop saved? Said another way, what file can I save so that after I comlete reinstall I can revert the configuration of my toolbars?
its a good idea to backup your entire home dir
my home directory is backed up.
In fact I have a home partition
if I have a home partition will that save the configuration of my tool bars?
yes, all the configuration for a user is inside his/hers home dir
but how does it work if my current home folder has the name emma and then when I reinstall I say my name is emma?
how do I avoid trouble there?
when you reinstall, dont format the home partition ;)
i won't but on the reinstall it's going to ask me for my log in name and such and that will be the same
which will create two home folders with the name emma and mess thingsup
you could only have problems if the users ids are different
to avoid this, you can specify the user id when creating the new user
and enter the same id you have now
- that sounds promising.  isn't the user id of the superuser 1000 ?
no, 1000 is the id of the first user
thats ok. so when reinstalling, enter the same user name, and thats it
and be shure of selecting '/home' as the mount point for your home partition
